abstract: The trade publication American Banker unveiled its Banker of the Year award last week: It went to Kenneth D. Lewis, chief of Bank of America.
snippet: The trade publication American Banker unveiled its Banker of the Year award last week: It went to Kenneth D. Lewis, chief of Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: It’s like being named the outstanding British soldier of 1776.

headline.main: Saluting a Banker in a Banking Year Worth Forgetting
headline.print_headline: Saluting a Banker In a Banking Year Worth Forgetting

abstract: Goal Financial is the latest student loan company to have reached a settlement agreement with the New York attorney general, whose investigation of the loan industry found that some were using deceptive tactics and offering prizes to attract borrowers, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater reported.
lead_paragraph: Goal Financial is the latest student loan company to have reached a settlement agreement with the New York attorney general, whose investigation of the loan industry found that some were using deceptive tactics and offering prizes to attract borrowers, The New York Times’s Jonathan D. Glater reported.

headline.main: Another Student Loan Company Settles With New York
